STOREKEEPER II
Professional Summary
The purpose of this document is to secure a responsible career position that fully utilizes educational knowledge and experience while contributing to the goals and values of this organization.
Having a friendly attitude and worm personality is an appreciated strong point, as it aided in building positive relationships with customers.
As a result, repeat and satisfied customers were well known during career at Pioneer Packaging as well as while working for City of Peoria.
Helping people is one of my best characteristics.
Obtaining several years experience contacting vendors, answering phones and face to face contact with the public and governmental personnel has honed my customer service abilities.
Problem solving skills and a positive work ethic makes communication easier.
I am devoted and dedicated to serving in any way possible, and strive to accomplish assigned tasks quickly and efficiently.
Exceptional people skills allow the ability to manage personnel and take care of conflicts, disputes and other personal needs of employees.
Procurement and Purchasing: Over 10 years processing purchase orders.
Primary vendor contact for Inventory Control and Fleet parts room purchases.
Highly proficient utilizing inventory procurement practices and procedures.

Routine cycle counts of inventory insure and verify, proper placement of inventory.

Maintain inventory and quality control procedures.
ACCOMPLISHMENTS Personal: Due to specialized training and procurement practices the City of Peoria had an annual savings of $1500.00 annually on costs of goods acquired by purchase order during career.
By developing a spreadsheet to record material requisitions and receiving logs, our department was able to stop purchasing preprinted forms from local vendor, as a result monthly operational cost were reduced.
Man hours during cycle counts and order pulling were also reduced through consolidating bulk inventory into more manageable amounts with the use of poly-bags rather than just dumping items into bin boxes.
Note: The points mentioned above are a small portion of the ideas introduced during career at City of Peoria.

<JD_START>
Job Title: CAS Air Force Writer / Intel Analyst

Location: Leesville, LA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Duties

Member of a five-man exercise CAOC, actively participate in scenario development processes to ensure air power is appropriately integrated. Monitor conduct of CAS missions and write analyses of those missions. Responsible for multiservice air integration into JRTC scenarios. Participates in rotational planning meetings in order to assist the Air Force 548 CTS integrate CAS in JRTC rotations. Responsible for replicating the functions of a USAF Combined Air Operation Center (CAOC) including the production of ATOs, ACOs and SPINS and processing pre-planned CAS requests. Air Intelligence cell produces DISUMs, INTREPs, ELINTREPS, and enemy Order of Battle daily updates as necessary and distributes them to exercise players. Tracks execution of CAS missions and writes mission analyses of those missions. Participates in rotational planning meetings, conducts briefings as required, and assists the Air Force in constructing After Action Reviews (AARs). 

Position Requirements

Qualifications

Required Experience:

Experience in preparation/executing debriefing military exercise/training (such as JRTC rotations) and responsibilities. 

Desired

Experience in numbered Air Force or higher headquarters. Experience working in an Air Operations Center or equivalent JRTC experience. Intelligence operations or aircrew experience in Close Air Support. Degree from an accredited college or university. Completion of Air Command and Staff College or equivalent.

Additional Requirements

Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Able to travel unaccompanied to continental US and foreign locations.Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Must submit to and pass pre-employment drug screening; will be subject to random drug screening.

NOTICE: Valiant Integrated Services NEVER asks job applicants to issue any payment or service fees to Valiant or its recruiters as part of our application process. Before providing any personal information to outside parties, verify that the job you are applying for appears on our Careers site.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
